etymology.description: phonetic: 并 (OC *peŋ, *peŋs) + semantic: 瓦 (“earthenware”); originally an earthenware vessel.
etymology.interpretation: 瓦 signals a pottery/earthenware material, pointing to a container, while 并 contributes the pronunciation. Early forms referred to slender‑necked vessels, often earthenware or bronze ritual pieces; in modern usage it extends to bottles of any kind.

examples.chinese: 请把空瓶回收(請把空瓶回收)。
他打碎了一个玻璃瓶(他打碎了一個玻璃瓶)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dǎsuì le yí gè bōli píng.

examples.chinese: 这瓶药一天吃三次(這瓶藥一天吃三次)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè píng yào yì tiān chī sān cì.
examples.english: Take this bottle of medicine three times a day.
